meanings.definition: The study of behavior in animals and humans.
meanings.sent1: In behaviourisms, researchers observe how animals and humans behave in different situations.
meanings.sent2: Scientists use behaviourisms to understand why animals and humans act the way they do.
meanings.sent3: The behaviourisms class had a fun field trip to the zoo to study animal behaviors.
meanings.sent4: Her interest in behaviourisms was sparked when she noticed similarities in how dogs and humans learn.
meanings.sent5: The behaviourisms lab was filled with charts and graphs showing patterns in behavior.

meanings.definition: The theory that behavior can be explained in terms of conditioning and reinforcement.
meanings.sent1: Behaviourisms suggest that behavior is influenced by conditioning and reinforcement.
meanings.sent2: Learning about behaviourisms helps us understand how rewards and punishments shape behavior.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked that his cat was a master of behaviourisms, always getting treats for good behavior.
meanings.sent4: In the world of business, understanding behaviourisms can help improve employee performance.
meanings.sent5: The concept of behaviourisms is like a puzzle, with each piece representing a different aspect of behavior.

meanings.definition: The observable actions or reactions of a person or animal in response to stimuli.
meanings.sent1: The behaviourisms of the dog included wagging its tail and barking when the doorbell rang.
meanings.sent2: Parents often use behaviourisms to encourage good manners in their children.
meanings.sent3: The behaviourisms of the squirrel stealing nuts from the bird feeder amused the onlookers.
meanings.sent4: Her behaviourisms at the party were a mix of excitement and nervousness.
meanings.sent5: The behaviourisms of the chameleon, changing color to blend in, fascinated the biologist.
